TitleText: 3	is the capital city of Greece with a metropolitan population of 3.7 million inhabitants .
4	It is in many ways the birthplace of Classical Greece , and therefore of Western civilization .
LeftText: 5	Understand
6	Old Athens
7	The first pre-historic settlements was constructed in 3000 BC around the hill of Acropolis .
8	The legend says
9	that the King of Athens , Theseus unified the ten tribes of early Athens into one kingdom
11	This process of synoikismos
12	– bringing together in one home –
13	created the largest and wealthiest state on the Greek mainland ,
14	but it also created a larger class of people excluded from political life by the nobility .
15	By the 7th century BC , social unrest had become widespread ,
16	and the Areopagus appointed Draco
17	to draft a strict new law code
18	( hence " draconian " ) .
19	When this failed ,
20	they appointed Solon , with a mandate to create a new constitution
22	This was the great beginning of a new social revolution ,
23	which was the result of the democracy under Clisthenes
25	During the Middle Ages , Athens experienced a decline ,
26	but re-emerged under Byzantian rule .
27	Athens was thriving and prosperous during the Crusades ,
28	actually benefiting from the Italian trade during this period .
29	However , this fruitful period was short - lived ,
30	as Greece suffered badly under the Ottoman Empire ,
31	only to recover in the 19th century as the capital of independent Greece .
32	Modern Olympic Games
33	Athens hosted the 2004 Summer Olympic Games .
34	While most of the sporting venues were located outside the city proper
35	- in various locations throughout Attica -
36	the entire urban area of Athens underwent major lasting changes
37	that have improved the quality of life for visitors and residents alike .
38	Aside from the excellent transportation infrastructure
39	that was completed in time for the 2004 Olympics
40	( from new freeways to light rail systems ) ,
41	the city 's historic center underwent serious renovation .
42	Most notable among the city 's facelift projects are the Unification of Archaeological Sites
43	- which connects the city 's classical - era ruins and monuments to each other through a network of pleasant pedestrianized streets -
44	and the restoration of the picturesque neoclassical Thissio and Pláka districts .
45	The ancient Olympic Games took place in Olympia from 776 BCE to 394 AD .
46	It is a lengthy day trip from Athens to visit Olympia ,
47	but quite interesting .

37	that have improved the quality of life for visitors and residents alike .
38	Aside from the excellent transportation infrastructure

48	Architecture
49	Athens was just a small provincial village
50	when it was chosen in the 1830s to serve as the national capital of the modern Greek State .
51	Although it had a prestigious past ,
52	the city 's political , economic , and cultural importance had declined over the centuries ,
53	leaving behind only its classical ruins as a reminder of better times .
54	With the decision
55	to move the national capital from Nafplio to Athens ,
56	architects and city planners were hired
57	to build a new city next to the classical ruins , with grand neoclassical homes and public buildings , large city squares , green spaces , and wide avenues ,
58	making a conscious , decisive turn from the city 's Ottoman past .
59	The city regained its importance in Greek civilization ,
60	and by 1900 had evolved into a very attractive cosmopolitan city , with abundant neoclassical architecture
61	harking to the nation 's past .
62	The 20th century however , marked the rapid development of Athens .
63	The city suffered minor damage during WWII ,
64	and suffered extensive urban planning in the decades
65	that followed ,
66	as the nation rapidly industrialized
67	and urbanized .
68	In the 1960s and 1970s , many 19th century neoclassical buildings , often small and private , were demolished
69	to make way for office buildings ,
70	often designed by great Greek architects .
71	The city also expanded outward through rash development , particularly towards the west ,
72	as its population grew
73	by absorbing job - seekers from the provinces .
74	With the onset of the automobile , public officials reduced the city 's public transportation services
75	without foreseeing the traffic gridlock and smog
76	that would menace the city by the 1980s .
77	By the late 1980s and early 1990s , the city 's reality led to a rude awakening among local and national officials
78	and ,
79	coupled with the country 's new found remarkable prosperity ,
80	large scale projects began to slowly regenerate the city and undo some of the damages of recent decades .

81	Over the course of the next 15 years , money was poured into new transportation infrastructure projects , the restoration of surviving neoclassical buildings , the gentrification of the city 's historical center and the renovation of many former industrial areas and the city 's coastline .
82	The restoration of charming neoclassical buildings in the city 's historical center has been accompanied by the construction of attractive post-modern buildings in newer districts ;
83	both of which have begun to improve the aesthetic essence of the city .
84	Athens today is ever evolving ,
85	forging a brand new identity for the 21st century .
86	Climate
87	Spring and late autumn are the best times to visit Athens .
88	Summer can be extremely hot and dry during heatwaves ,
89	but this rarely happens .
90	Winter is definitely low season , with the occasional rainy or snowy day ,
91	but also an ideal time
92	to save money
93	while enjoying the city without countless other travelers and tourists .
94	Whilst peak traffic hour can be a bit smoggy on the main roads ,
95	on most sunny days the skies are azure blue .
96	The main reason attributed for the pollution of Athens is because the city is enclosed by mountains in a basin
97	which does not let the smog leave .
98	The government 's ban on diesel vehicles within Athens and the early 1990s initiatives
99	to improve car emissions
100	have greatly contributed to better atmospheric conditions in the basin .

97	which does not let the smog leave .
98	The government 's ban on diesel vehicles within Athens and the early 1990s initiatives
99	to improve car emissions
100	have greatly contributed to better atmospheric conditions in the basin .

LeftText: 87	Spring and late autumn are the best times to visit Athens .
88	Summer can be extremely hot and dry during heatwaves ,
89	but this rarely happens .
90	Winter is definitely low season , with the occasional rainy or snowy day ,
91	but also an ideal time
92	to save money
93	while enjoying the city without countless other travelers and tourists .
94	Whilst peak traffic hour can be a bit smoggy on the main roads ,
95	on most sunny days the skies are azure blue .
